biosecLogger.core

Class StorageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • biosecLogger.core.StorageHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Analyzer.ExStorageHandler, ExtendedStorageHandler

    public class StorageHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    StorageHandler is supposed to handle saving and loading files. Handler also works with internal and external storage.
    Author:
    Stefan Smihla

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String EXTERNAL_DIRECTORY

      Checks if external storage is available.

      Loads file from external or internal storage.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StorageHandler

        public StorageHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • checkEnvironment

        protected static int checkEnvironment()
        Checks if external storage is available. Returns integer constant about its state. 0 if WRITABLE, 1 if READABLE, 2 if UNMOUNTED
        Returns:
        state of environment

      • saveFile

        protected static boolean saveFile(java.lang.String filename,
               java.lang.String content,
               Context ctx,
               boolean b64encode)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Save file to storage.
        Parameters:
        filename - new file name
        content - content of file
        ctx - if activity context is set, file is saved to internal storage, otherwise to external storage
        b64encode - if true, content of file is base64 encoded
        Returns:
        true if file is saved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - raises when file could not be saved

      • removeDataFiles

        protected static void removeDataFiles(Context ctx)
        Removes all internal storage data.
        Parameters:
        ctx - activity context

      • loadFile

        protected static java.lang.String loadFile(java.lang.String filename,
                        Context ctx)
                                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                           java.io.IOException
        Loads file from external or internal storage.
        Parameters:
        filename - file to be loaded
        ctx - if activity context is present, file will be loaded from internal storage, otherwise external storage is used
        Returns:
        content of file
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - raises when file is not found
        java.io.IOException - raises when couldn't read from file
